name: European Passenger Transport Operators
goal: EPTO is the association of European Passenger Transport Operators and represents the leading transport services organisations in Europe, whose members are presently the seven largest public transport companies in Europe: Arriva, First Group, Go-Ahead, Grupo Barraqueiro, Keolis, National Express and Stagecoach. Members cover 28 countries (of which 18 EU) and carry 10 Billion Passengers p.a.
interests: Business and Industry, Competition, Consumers, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Institutional affairs, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
Liberalisation - the introduction of fair and transparent tendering in public transport;
Fair market conditions - consistent application of the EU policies by countries;
State aid - transparent and fair use of funds to develop transport;
Road Transport Package - practical and fair application of the legislation to cover all aspects of road passenger transport;
EU 1370/2007 - fair and proper application of the legislation in all countries;
EU 1073/2009 - practical and fair application of the legislation in all countries;
Passenger rights - practical and fair legislation;
Ticketing, pricing and technology - practical and fair application
